html: he shall break it as the breaking of the potters' vessel. Isaiah likens the fall of Judah to a shattered clay vessel that can no longer serve its original purpose. Not a single shard (a fragment of the shattered vessel) is large enough to serve as a scoop "to take fire from the hearth" or "to take water" from a pool of water. Similarly, Judah's inhabitants are not suitable to serve as God's holy people.
